name: WebSocketFramework

values.name: decodePlist
values.comment: Decode a list of key/value pairs into a message.
values.type: Json.Decode.Decoder message -> WebSocketFramework.Types.Plist -> Result.Result String message

values.name: makeProxyServer
values.comment:
Make a client connection to a proxy server.

No WebSocket connection will be used to send messages.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerMessageProcessor gamestate player message -> (WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerInterface gamestate player message msg -> message -> msg) -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerInterface gamestate player message msg

values.name: makeServer
values.comment:
Make a client connection to a real WebSocket server.

The `msg` will usually be a no-operation message. It is only used to fill a slot in the returned `ServerInterface`. That slot is only used by the proxy server.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.MessageEncoder message -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerUrl -> msg -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerInterface gamestate player message msg

values.name: send
values.comment: Return a `Cmd` to send a message through a server interface.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerInterface gamestate player message msg -> message -> Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg

values.name: unknownMessage
values.comment: Return an `Err` reporting on an unknown message name.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.ReqRsp -> Result.Result String message

name: WebSocketFramework.ServerInterface

values.name: addGame
values.comment:
Add a game to a `ServerState`.

Adds the game ID to the added games list in changes, so that the server code will update its tables.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.GameId -> gamestate -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player

values.name: addPlayer
values.comment:
Add a player to a `ServerState`.

Adds the player ID to the added players list in changes, so that the server code will update its tables.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.PlayerId -> WebSocketFramework.Types.PlayerInfo player -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player

values.name: appendPublicGames
values.comment: Push a `PublicGame` onto a list of them.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.PublicGame -> WebSocketFramework.Types.PublicGames -> WebSocketFramework.Types.PublicGames

values.name: checkGameid
values.comment:
Check that the passed `GameId` is in the `ServerState`'s game dict and that it satisifed the `ModeChecker`.

If it does, return the `gamestate`. Otherwise wrap the message in an `ErrorRsp`.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.ModeChecker gamestate message -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player -> message -> WebSocketFramework.Types.GameId -> Result.Result (WebSocketFramework.Types.ErrorRsp message) gamestate

values.name: checkOnlyGameid
values.comment:
Check that the passed `GameId` is in the `ServerState`'s game dict.

If it is, return the `gamestate`. Otherwise wrap the message in an `ErrorRsp`.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player -> message -> WebSocketFramework.Types.GameId -> Result.Result (WebSocketFramework.Types.ErrorRsp message) gamestate

values.name: checkPlayerid
values.comment:
Check that the passed `PlayerId` is in the `ServerState`'s player dict.

If it is, return the `PlayerInfo` record for the player.

Otherwise wrap the message in an `ErrorRsp`.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player -> message -> WebSocketFramework.Types.PlayerId -> Result.Result (WebSocketFramework.Types.ErrorRsp message) (WebSocketFramework.Types.PlayerInfo player)

values.name: dummyGameid
values.comment: `"<gameid>"`
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.GameId

values.name: errorRsp
values.comment: Create the ErrorRsp record returned in the errors from `CheckOnlyGameid`, `checkGameid`, and `checkPlayerid`.
values.type: message -> String -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ErrorRsp message

values.name: fullMessageProcessor
values.comment:
Simulate a round-trip through the message encoder, decoder, and message processor.

Returns a function that takes a request message, encodes it, decodes it, processes it into a response, encodes and decodes that, then returns the result.

Usually passed as the first arg to `makeProxyServer`.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.EncodeDecode message -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerMessageProcessor gamestate player message -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerMessageProcessor gamestate player message

values.name: getGame
values.comment: Look up the gamestate for a GameId
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.GameId -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player -> Maybe.Maybe gamestate

values.name: getPlayer
values.comment: Look up the PlayerInfo for a PlayerId
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.PlayerId -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player -> Maybe.Maybe (WebSocketFramework.Types.PlayerInfo player)

values.name: getServer
values.comment: Return the server URL from inside a ServerInterface.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerInterface gamestate player message msg -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerUrl

values.name: makeProxyServer
values.comment:
Make a client connection to a proxy server.

No WebSocket connection will be used to send messages.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerMessageProcessor gamestate player message -> (WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerInterface gamestate player message msg -> message -> msg) -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerInterface gamestate player message msg

values.name: makeServer
values.comment:
Make a client connection to a real WebSocket server.

The `msg` will usually be a no-operation message. It is only used to fill a slot in the returned `ServerInterface`. That slot is only used by the proxy server.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.MessageEncoder message -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerUrl -> msg -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerInterface gamestate player message msg

values.name: newGameid
values.comment:
Generate a random GameId string, ensuring that it is not already assigned to a game.

Will not be used by servers that have no concept of a game.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player -> ( WebSocketFramework.Types.GameId , WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player )

values.name: newPlayerid
values.comment:
Generate a random PlayerId string, ensuring that it is not already assigned to a player.

Will not be used by servers that have no concept of a player.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player -> ( WebSocketFramework.Types.PlayerId , WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player )

values.name: removeGame
values.comment:
Remove a game and its players from a `ServerState`.

Removes the game ID from the removed games list in changes, so that the server code will update its tables.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.GameId -> List WebSocketFramework.Types.PlayerId -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player

values.name: removePlayer
values.comment:
Remove a player from a `ServerState`.

Adds the player ID to the removed players list in changes, so that the server code will update its tables.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.PlayerId -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player

values.name: removePublicGame
values.comment: Remove the `PublicGame` with the given `GameId` from a list of games.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.GameId -> WebSocketFramework.Types.PublicGames -> WebSocketFramework.Types.PublicGames

values.name: send
values.comment: Return a `Cmd` to send a message through a server interface.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerInterface gamestate player message msg -> message -> Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg

values.name: updateGame
values.comment:
Update the gamestate for a GameId.

Pass `Nothing` to remove the game's state.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.GameId -> Maybe.Maybe gamestate -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player

values.name: updatePlayer
values.comment:
Update the PlyaerInfo for a PlayerId.

Pass `Nothing` to remove the player's info.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.PlayerId -> Maybe.Maybe (WebSocketFramework.Types.PlayerInfo player) -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player

name: WebSocketFramework.EncodeDecode

values.name: decodeMessage
values.comment: User a `MessageDecoder` that you write to turn a string into a message.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.MessageDecoder message -> String -> Result.Result String message

values.name: decodePlist
values.comment: Decode a list of key/value pairs into a message.
values.type: Json.Decode.Decoder message -> WebSocketFramework.Types.Plist -> Result.Result String message

values.name: decodeRawMessage
values.comment: Turn a string into a raw message.
values.type: String -> Result.Result String WebSocketFramework.Types.RawMessage

values.name: encodeMessage
values.comment: Use a `MessageEncoder` that you write to turn a message into a string.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.MessageEncoder message -> message -> String

values.name: genericMessageDecoder
values.comment:
Simplify the writing of `MessageDecoder` definitions.

Takes two plists mapping request names to decoders and response names to decoders.

Returns a `MessageDecoder` that uses them.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.DecoderPlist msg -> WebSocketFramework.Types.DecoderPlist msg -> WebSocketFramework.Types.MessageDecoder msg

values.name: messageDecoder
values.comment: Create a `Decoder` for `decodeMessage`.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.MessageDecoder message -> Json.Decode.Decoder message

values.name: messageEncoder
values.comment:
Use a `MessageEncoder` that you write to turn a message into a `Value`.

Rarely used by anything but `encodeMessage`.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.MessageEncoder message -> message -> Json.Encode.Value

values.name: rawMessageDecoder
values.comment: The `Decoder` used by `decodeRawMessage`
values.type: Json.Decode.Decoder WebSocketFramework.Types.RawMessage

values.name: rawMessageEncoder
values.comment: Turn a raw message into a `Value`.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.RawMessage -> Json.Encode.Value

name: WebSocketFramework.Types

aliases.name: Changes
aliases.comment:
Used to inform the server of added and removed games and players.

Interact with it via `ServerInterface.addGame`, `addPlayer`, `removeGame`, `removePlayer`.
aliases.type: { addedGames : List WebSocketFramework.Types.GameId , addedPlayers : List ( WebSocketFramework.Types.GameId , WebSocketFramework.Types.PlayerId ) , removedGames : List WebSocketFramework.Types.GameId , removedPlayers : List ( WebSocketFramework.Types.GameId , WebSocketFramework.Types.PlayerId ) }

aliases.name: DecoderPlist
aliases.comment: Map a list of request or response names to decoders for their messages.

aliases.name: EncodeDecode
aliases.comment: Wrapping of encoder, decoder, and error message creator.
aliases.type: { encoder : WebSocketFramework.Types.MessageEncoder message , decoder : WebSocketFramework.Types.MessageDecoder message , errorWrapper : Maybe.Maybe (WebSocketFramework.Types.Error message -> message) }

aliases.name: Error
aliases.comment:
Description of an error passed to `EncodeDecode.errorWrapper`.

If `kind` is `JsonParseError`, then `description` is the message text,
and `message` is the error returned from parsing it.

If `kind` is `UnspecifiedError`, then `description` is user-level text,
and `message` is `Ok` wrapped around the relevant message, if there
is one, or `Err` wrapped around some likely useless string.
aliases.type: { kind : WebSocketFramework.Types.ErrorKind , description : String , message : Result.Result String message }

aliases.name: ErrorRsp
aliases.comment: An error response that encapsulates a request message and an error string.

aliases.name: GameId
aliases.comment: An alias for `String`.

aliases.name: InputPort
aliases.comment: The input port from the Node.js code to the WebSocket server.

aliases.name: MessageDecoder
aliases.comment: Type signature for a function that turns a request or response and a key/value list into a message.

aliases.name: MessageEncoder
aliases.comment: Type signature for a function that turns a message into request or response and a key/value list.

aliases.name: MessageToGameid
aliases.comment: Type signature of a function that extracts the game id from a message, if it has one.

aliases.name: ModeChecker
aliases.comment:
Type signature of a function that checks if a message is a legal request for a gamestate.

An `Err` result has a message string. An `Ok` result maps an unusable value.

aliases.name: OutputPort
aliases.comment: The output port from the WebSocket server to the Node.js code.

aliases.name: PlayerId
aliases.comment: An alias for `String`.

aliases.name: PlayerInfo
aliases.comment: Information about a player in a game

aliases.name: Plist
aliases.comment: A list of key/value pairs.

aliases.name: PublicGame
aliases.comment: If your server supports public games, this represents the game id and name of the creator of the game.

aliases.name: PublicGames
aliases.comment: A list of pubic games.

aliases.name: RawMessage
aliases.comment:
A raw request, ready to be encoded to go over the wire.

`reqrsp` is "req" or "rsp" for request or response.

`msg` is the name of the message.

`plist` is the parameters of the message.
aliases.type: { reqrsp : String , msg : String , plist : WebSocketFramework.Types.Plist }

aliases.name: ServerMessageProcessor
aliases.comment: Type signature of a function which turns a server state and a request message into a ServerState and maybe a response message.
aliases.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player -> message -> ( WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player , Maybe.Maybe message )

aliases.name: ServerState
aliases.comment:
The part of the server state that is independent from its socket connections.

You might think that the names are per game, and you'd be right to think that.
They're not in the GameState, because they don't need to go over the wire,
except in the JoinRsp.

They're stored in a Dict in the Server model.
aliases.type: { gameDict : Dict.Dict WebSocketFramework.Types.GameId gamestate , playerDict : Dict.Dict WebSocketFramework.Types.PlayerId (WebSocketFramework.Types.PlayerInfo player) , publicGames : WebSocketFramework.Types.PublicGames , state : Maybe.Maybe gamestate , seed : Random.Seed , changes : Maybe.Maybe WebSocketFramework.Types.Changes }

aliases.name: ServerUrl
aliases.comment: An alias for `String`.

types.name: ErrorKind
types.comment: The kind of error being reported in an `Error` instance.

types.name: ReqRsp
types.comment: A type safe representation of the `reqrsp` and `msg` fields of a `RawMessage`.

types.name: ServerInterface
types.comment: Everything necessary to communicate with a server, be it real or proxy.
cases: { server : WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerUrl , wrapper : WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerInterface gamestate player message msg -> message -> msg , state : Maybe.Maybe (WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player) , sender : WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerInterface gamestate player message msg -> message -> Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg }

values.name: emptyPublicGames
values.comment: An empty list of public games.
values.type: WebSocketFramework.Types.PublicGames

values.name: emptyServerState
values.comment: Create a mostly empty `ServerState`.
values.type: Maybe.Maybe gamestate -> WebSocketFramework.Types.ServerState gamestate player

values.name: printifyString
values.comment: Convert ASCII double-quote characters to curly end quotes.
values.type: String -> String
